page.title: 01Clyde Valley Area
page.content: The area covered in this survey is largely rural and includes the village of Kirkfieldbank, which is located on the River Clyde. At this point the river is about 100 feet wide. The village is the place also where the smaller River Mouse runs into the Clyde. In the area there are many fruit growers; raspberries, strawberries, and tomatoes grown under glass. There has been a decline into tomato growing recently due to foreign competition. The area also includes many fine farms. These are mainly dairy or mixed arable and sheep and cattle. Many of the local people travel to Lanark or the Motherwell/ Wishaw area to find employment. The area being in the Clyde Valley and being slightly milder in summer than on higher ground attracts many day visitors.
